com.idevicesinc.sweetblue

Class BleDeviceConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleNodeConfig
      • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleDeviceConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BleManagerConfig

    public class BleDeviceConfig
extends BleNodeConfig
implements Cloneable
    Provides a number of options to (optionally) pass to BleDevice.setConfig(BleDeviceConfig). This class is also a super class of BleManagerConfig, which you can pass to BleManager.get(Context, BleManagerConfig) or BleManager.setConfig(BleManagerConfig) to set default base options for all devices at once. For all options in this class, you may set the value to null when passed to BleDevice.setConfig(BleDeviceConfig) and the value will then be inherited from the BleManagerConfig passed to BleManager.get(Context, BleManagerConfig). Otherwise, if the value is not null it will override any option in the BleManagerConfig. If an option is ultimately null (null when passed to BleDevice.setConfig(BleDeviceConfig) *and* BleManager.get(Context, BleManagerConfig)) then it is interpreted as false or Interval.DISABLED.

    TIP: You can use Interval.DISABLED instead of null to disable any keepalive-based options, for code readability's sake.

    TIP: You can use newNulled() (or BleNodeConfig.nullOut()) then only set the few options you want for BleDevice.setConfig(BleDeviceConfig).

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  BleDeviceConfig.BondFilter
      As of now there are two main default uses for this class...
      static class  BleDeviceConfig.DefaultBondFilter
      Default implementation of BleDeviceConfig.BondFilter that unbonds for certain phone models upon discovery and disconnects.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleNodeConfig

        BleNodeConfig.DefaultHistoricalDataLogFilter, BleNodeConfig.DefaultReconnectFilter, BleNodeConfig.DefaultTaskTimeoutRequestFilter, BleNodeConfig.HistoricalDataFactory, BleNodeConfig.HistoricalDataLogFilter, BleNodeConfig.ReconnectFilter, BleNodeConfig.TaskTimeoutRequestFilter

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Boolean allowDuplicatePollEntries
      Default is falsese - if true and you call BleDevice.startPoll(UUID, Interval, BleDevice.ReadWriteListener) or BleDevice.startChangeTrackingPoll(UUID, Interval, BleDevice.ReadWriteListener)() with identical parameters then two identical polls would run which would probably be wasteful and unintentional.
      Boolean autoGetServices
      Default is true - whether to automatically get services immediately after a BleDevice is BleDeviceState.CONNECTED.
      Boolean autoReconnectDeviceWhenBleTurnsBackOn
      Default is true - if devices are kept in memory for a BleManager.turnOff()/BleManager.turnOn() cycle (or a BleManager.reset()) because retainDeviceWhenBleTurnsOff is true, then a BleDevice.connect() will be attempted for any devices that were previously BleDeviceState.CONNECTED.
      BleDeviceConfig.BondFilter bondFilter
      Default is instance of BleDeviceConfig.DefaultBondFilter.
      Boolean bondingFailFailsConnection
      Default is true - controls whether BleDevice.ConnectionFailListener.Status.BONDING_FAILED is capable of inducing BleDevice.ConnectionFailListener.onEvent(com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleDevice.ConnectionFailListener.ConnectionFailEvent) while a device is BleDeviceState.CONNECTING_OVERALL.
      Boolean cacheDeviceOnUndiscovery
      Default is true - controls whether a BleDevice is placed into an in-memory cache when it becomes BleDeviceState.UNDISCOVERED.
      static double DEFAULT_MINIMUM_SCAN_TIME 
      static double DEFAULT_RSSI_AUTO_POLL_RATE
      Default value for rssiAutoPollRate.
      static int DEFAULT_RSSI_MAX
      Default fallback value for rssi_max.

      Default fallback value for rssi_min.
      static int DEFAULT_RUNNING_AVERAGE_N 
      static double DEFAULT_SCAN_KEEP_ALIVE 
      static int DEFAULT_TX_POWER
      Default value for defaultTxPower.
      Integer defaultTxPower
      Default is DEFAULT_TX_POWER - this value is used if we can't establish a device's calibrated transmission power from the device itself, either through its scan record or by reading the standard characteristic.
      Boolean includeOtaReadWriteTimesInAverage
      Default is false - BleDevice.getAverageReadTime() and BleDevice.getAverageWriteTime() can be skewed if the peripheral you are connecting to adjusts its maximum throughput for OTA firmware updates and the like.
      Boolean manageLastDisconnectOnDisk
      Default is true - controls whether the State.ChangeIntent behind a device going BleDeviceState.DISCONNECTED is saved to and loaded from disk so that it can be restored across app sessions, undiscoveries, and BLE BleManagerState.OFF->BleManagerState.ON cycles.
      Interval minScanTimeNeededForUndiscovery
      Default is DEFAULT_MINIMUM_SCAN_TIME seconds - Undiscovery of devices must be approximated by checking when the last time was that we discovered a device, and if this time is greater than undiscoveryKeepAlive then the device is undiscovered.
      Integer nForAverageRunningReadTime
      Default is DEFAULT_RUNNING_AVERAGE_N - Same thing as nForAverageRunningWriteTime but for reads.
      Integer nForAverageRunningWriteTime
      Default is DEFAULT_RUNNING_AVERAGE_N - The number of historical write times that the library should keep track of when calculating average time.
      Boolean retainDeviceWhenBleTurnsOff
      Default is true - controls whether BleManager will keep a device in active memory when it goes BleManagerState.OFF.
      Integer rssi_max
      Default is DEFAULT_RSSI_MAX - the estimated maximum value for BleDevice.getRssi().
      Integer rssi_min
      Default is DEFAULT_RSSI_MIN - the estimated minimum value for BleDevice.getRssi().
      Interval rssiAutoPollRate
      Default is DEFAULT_RSSI_AUTO_POLL_RATE - The rate at which a BleDevice will automatically poll for its BleDevice.getRssi() value after it's BleDeviceState.CONNECTED.
      Boolean saveNameChangesToDisk
      Default is true - controls whether changes to a device's name through BleDevice.setName(String) are remembered on disk through SharedPreferences.
      Boolean tryBondingWhileDisconnected
      Default is true - some devices can only reliably become BleDeviceState.BONDED while BleDeviceState.DISCONNECTED, so this option controls whether the library will internally change any bonding flow dictated by bondFilter when a bond fails and try to bond again the next time the device is BleDeviceState.DISCONNECTED.
      Boolean tryBondingWhileDisconnected_manageOnDisk
      Default is true - controls whether any bonding issues worked around if tryBondingWhileDisconnected is true are remembered on disk (through SharedPreferences) so that bonding is as stable as possible across application sessions.
      Boolean undiscoverDeviceWhenBleTurnsOff
      Default is true - only applicable if retainDeviceWhenBleTurnsOff is also true.
      Interval undiscoveryKeepAlive
      Default is disabled - If a device exceeds this amount of time since its last discovery then it is a candidate for being undiscovered.
      Boolean useGattRefresh
      Default is false - whether to use BluetoothGatt.refresh() right before service discovery.

      • tryBondingWhileDisconnected

        public Boolean tryBondingWhileDisconnected
        Default is true - some devices can only reliably become BleDeviceState.BONDED while BleDeviceState.DISCONNECTED, so this option controls whether the library will internally change any bonding flow dictated by bondFilter when a bond fails and try to bond again the next time the device is BleDeviceState.DISCONNECTED.

        NOTE: This option was added after noticing this behavior with the Samsung Tab 4 running 4.4.4.

      • tryBondingWhileDisconnected_manageOnDisk

        public Boolean tryBondingWhileDisconnected_manageOnDisk
        Default is true - controls whether any bonding issues worked around if tryBondingWhileDisconnected is true are remembered on disk (through SharedPreferences) so that bonding is as stable as possible across application sessions.

      • saveNameChangesToDisk

        public Boolean saveNameChangesToDisk
        Default is true - controls whether changes to a device's name through BleDevice.setName(String) are remembered on disk through SharedPreferences. If true, this means calls to BleDevice.getName_override() will return the same thing even across app restarts.

      • autoGetServices

        public Boolean autoGetServices
        Default is true - whether to automatically get services immediately after a BleDevice is BleDeviceState.CONNECTED. Currently this is the only way to get a device's services.

      • allowDuplicatePollEntries

        public Boolean allowDuplicatePollEntries
        Default is falsese - if true and you call BleDevice.startPoll(UUID, Interval, BleDevice.ReadWriteListener) or BleDevice.startChangeTrackingPoll(UUID, Interval, BleDevice.ReadWriteListener)() with identical parameters then two identical polls would run which would probably be wasteful and unintentional. This option provides a defense against that situation.

      • includeOtaReadWriteTimesInAverage

        public Boolean includeOtaReadWriteTimesInAverage
        Default is false - BleDevice.getAverageReadTime() and BleDevice.getAverageWriteTime() can be skewed if the peripheral you are connecting to adjusts its maximum throughput for OTA firmware updates and the like. Use this option to let the library know whether you want read/writes to factor in while BleDeviceState.PERFORMING_OTA.
        See Also:
        BleDevice.getAverageReadTime(), BleDevice.getAverageWriteTime()

      • retainDeviceWhenBleTurnsOff

        public Boolean retainDeviceWhenBleTurnsOff
        Default is true - controls whether BleManager will keep a device in active memory when it goes BleManagerState.OFF. If false then a device will be purged and you'll have to do BleManager.startScan() again to discover devices if/when BleManager goes back BleManagerState.ON.

        NOTE: if this flag is true for BleManagerConfig passed to BleManager.get(Context, BleManagerConfig) then this applies to all devices.

      • undiscoverDeviceWhenBleTurnsOff

        public Boolean undiscoverDeviceWhenBleTurnsOff
        Default is true - only applicable if retainDeviceWhenBleTurnsOff is also true. If retainDeviceWhenBleTurnsOff is false then devices will be undiscovered when BleManager goes BleManagerState.OFF regardless.

        NOTE: See NOTE for retainDeviceWhenBleTurnsOff for how this applies to BleManagerConfig.
        See Also:
        retainDeviceWhenBleTurnsOff, autoReconnectDeviceWhenBleTurnsBackOn

      • autoReconnectDeviceWhenBleTurnsBackOn

        public Boolean autoReconnectDeviceWhenBleTurnsBackOn
        Default is true - if devices are kept in memory for a BleManager.turnOff()/BleManager.turnOn() cycle (or a BleManager.reset()) because retainDeviceWhenBleTurnsOff is true, then a BleDevice.connect() will be attempted for any devices that were previously BleDeviceState.CONNECTED.

        NOTE: See NOTE for retainDeviceWhenBleTurnsOff for how this applies to BleManagerConfig.
        See Also:
        retainDeviceWhenBleTurnsOff

      • manageLastDisconnectOnDisk

        public Boolean manageLastDisconnectOnDisk
        Default is true - controls whether the State.ChangeIntent behind a device going BleDeviceState.DISCONNECTED is saved to and loaded from disk so that it can be restored across app sessions, undiscoveries, and BLE BleManagerState.OFF->BleManagerState.ON cycles. This uses Android's SharedPreferences so does not require any extra permissions. The main advantage of this is the following scenario: User connects to a device through your app, does what they want, kills the app, then opens the app sometime later. BleDevice.getLastDisconnectIntent() returns State.ChangeIntent.UNINTENTIONAL, which lets you know that you can probably automatically connect to this device without user confirmation.

      • cacheDeviceOnUndiscovery

        public Boolean cacheDeviceOnUndiscovery
        Default is true - controls whether a BleDevice is placed into an in-memory cache when it becomes BleDeviceState.UNDISCOVERED. If true, subsequent calls to BleManager.DiscoveryListener.onEvent(BleManager.DiscoveryListener.DiscoveryEvent) with BleManager.DiscoveryListener.LifeCycle.DISCOVERED (or calls to BleManager.newDevice(String)) will return the cached BleDevice instead of creating a new one.

        The advantages of caching are:
        • Slightly better performance at the cost of some retained memory, especially in situations where you're frequently discovering and undiscovering many devices.
        • Resistance to future stack failures that would otherwise mean missing data like BleDevice.getAdvertisedServices() for future discovery events.
        • More resistant to potential "user error" of retaining devices in app-land after BleManager undiscovery.

            This is kept as an option in case there's some unforeseen problem with devices being cached for a certain application. See also minScanTimeNeededForUndiscovery.

      • bondingFailFailsConnection

        public Boolean bondingFailFailsConnection
        Default is true - controls whether BleDevice.ConnectionFailListener.Status.BONDING_FAILED is capable of inducing BleDevice.ConnectionFailListener.onEvent(com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleDevice.ConnectionFailListener.ConnectionFailEvent) while a device is BleDeviceState.CONNECTING_OVERALL.

      • useGattRefresh

        public Boolean useGattRefresh
        Default is false - whether to use BluetoothGatt.refresh() right before service discovery. This method is not in the public Android API, so its use is disabled by default. You may find it useful to enable if your remote device is routinely changing its gatt service profile. This method call supposedly clears a cache that would otherwise prevent changes from being discovered.

      • minScanTimeNeededForUndiscovery

        public Interval minScanTimeNeededForUndiscovery
        Default is DEFAULT_MINIMUM_SCAN_TIME seconds - Undiscovery of devices must be approximated by checking when the last time was that we discovered a device, and if this time is greater than undiscoveryKeepAlive then the device is undiscovered. However a scan operation must be allowed a certain amount of time to make sure it discovers all nearby devices that are still advertising. This is that time in seconds.

        Use Interval.DISABLED to disable undiscovery altogether.
        See Also:
        BleManager.DiscoveryListener.onEvent(DiscoveryEvent), undiscoveryKeepAlive

      • undiscoveryKeepAlive

        public Interval undiscoveryKeepAlive
        Default is disabled - If a device exceeds this amount of time since its last discovery then it is a candidate for being undiscovered. The default for this option attempts to accommodate the worst Android phones (BLE-wise), which may make it seem like it takes a long time to undiscover a device. You may want to configure this number based on the phone or manufacturer. For example, based on testing, in order to make undiscovery snappier the Galaxy S5 could use lower times.

        Use Interval.DISABLED to disable undiscovery altogether.
        See Also:
        BleManager.DiscoveryListener.onEvent(DiscoveryEvent), minScanTimeNeededForUndiscovery

      • rssiAutoPollRate

        public Interval rssiAutoPollRate
        Default is DEFAULT_RSSI_AUTO_POLL_RATE - The rate at which a BleDevice will automatically poll for its BleDevice.getRssi() value after it's BleDeviceState.CONNECTED. You may also use BleDevice.startRssiPoll(Interval, ReadWriteListener) for more control and feedback.

      • nForAverageRunningWriteTime

        public Integer nForAverageRunningWriteTime
        Default is DEFAULT_RUNNING_AVERAGE_N - The number of historical write times that the library should keep track of when calculating average time.
        See Also:
        BleDevice.getAverageWriteTime(), nForAverageRunningReadTime

      • nForAverageRunningReadTime

        public Integer nForAverageRunningReadTime
        Default is DEFAULT_RUNNING_AVERAGE_N - Same thing as nForAverageRunningWriteTime but for reads.
        See Also:
        BleDevice.getAverageWriteTime(), nForAverageRunningWriteTime

      • defaultTxPower

        public Integer defaultTxPower
        Default is DEFAULT_TX_POWER - this value is used if we can't establish a device's calibrated transmission power from the device itself, either through its scan record or by reading the standard characteristic. To get a good value for this on a per-remote-device basis experimentally, simply run a sample app and use BleDevice.startRssiPoll(Interval, ReadWriteListener) and spit BleDevice.getRssi() to your log. The average value of BleDevice.getRssi() at one meter away is the value you should use for this config option.
        See Also:
        BleDevice.getTxPower()

      • rssi_min

        public Integer rssi_min
        Default is DEFAULT_RSSI_MIN - the estimated minimum value for BleDevice.getRssi().

      • rssi_max

        public Integer rssi_max
        Default is DEFAULT_RSSI_MAX - the estimated maximum value for BleDevice.getRssi().

      • bondFilter

        public BleDeviceConfig.BondFilter bondFilter
        Default is instance of BleDeviceConfig.DefaultBondFilter.
        See Also:
        BleDeviceConfig.BondFilter

    • Constructor Detail

      • BleDeviceConfig

        public BleDeviceConfig()
        Creates a BleDeviceConfig with all default options set. See each member of this class for what the default options are set to. Consider using newNulled() also.

    • Method Detail

        public static BleDeviceConfig newNulled()
        Convenience method that returns a nulled out BleDeviceConfig, which is useful when using BleDevice.setConfig(BleDeviceConfig) to only override a few options from BleManagerConfig passed to BleManager.get(Context, BleManagerConfig) or BleManager.setConfig(BleManagerConfig).
